meanings.definition: To remove the straps from something.
meanings.sent1: She was unstrapping her backpack after a long day at school.
meanings.sent2: The firefighter quickly unstrapped the safety harness to rescue the trapped cat.
meanings.sent3: In a hurry, he unstrapped his seatbelt and jumped out of the car.
meanings.sent4: The magician unstrapped himself from the straightjacket in seconds, astonishing the audience.
meanings.sent5: With a swift motion, she unstrapped the baby from the stroller, ready to carry him.

meanings.sent1: The unstrapping bag kept swinging wildly as she walked.
meanings.sent2: The unstrapping suitcase fell open, spilling clothes everywhere.
meanings.sent3: The unstrapping tent flapped in the wind, threatening to fly away.
meanings.sent4: The unstrapping helmet slipped off his head during the bumpy ride.
meanings.sent5: The unstrapping sandals were comfortable but kept slipping off her feet.
